reviewText: I admit it, I live in New Mexico.  I have been to and seen in detail most of the places in these films.  It was what drew me to them and Hillerman's stories in general.  But even if I lived in Florida, they are nice stories and kept me entertained all through the first, and second and third, in sequence, at one sitting.  For me, it doesn't get any better than that.

reviewText: I thoroughly enjoy Tony Hillerman's Lt. Leaphorn & Jim Chee books. These made for TV movies brought the characters to life. Good stories, well acted, enjoyable even if you haven't read the books. Awesome insight into Navajo culture.
summary: skinwalkers; coyote waits; a thief of time
Title: N/A

reviewText: I would recommend buying all three( Skinwalkers, Coyote Waits, and Thief of time.) Getting them as a set is a good deal. I only wish there were other Tony Hillerman mysteries on DVD (not some of the amaturish knock offs, but the real thing produced, dircted and well acted by people who know how to bring a well loved story to the screen.)Leaphorn is a big city detective who returns to the res with his wife when she becomes ill, Chee is and wants to remain on the res in spite of a girl friend who wants him to go with her to the big city, a path Leaphorn once took, their tensions mirror the tention between the res and the outside world and is played out through the choices they make and the mysteries they solve, to bring "harmony" back to the res.Guess thats what most of us like about mysteries, they "put right" a small part of the world.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After reading the three books, I watched the stories on DVD.  The movies were perfect, adhering to the books as written.  The actors selected fit the roles perfectly and were actual Native Americans.  As much as I enjoyed the mystery, I enjoyed the feeling of the Native Americans living in the southwest, their customs and coping with "white man's America while preserving their own heritage and lives.  I recommend this collection to everyone.
summary: Tony Hillerman DVD Collection - Skinwalkers, Coyote Waits, A Thief of Time

reviewText: I really enjoyed these three mysteries.  The actors are perfect in their rolls.  The  mysteries take place on an Indian reservation and solved by 2 tribal policemen.  The first movie has the 2 officers meet and start working together.  As the movies progress they develop an understanding of how each other work and develop a friendship.  I would recommend these movies.
Title: N/A

reviewText: We saw the originals on PBS at least five years ago and recently began reading all the Hillerman novels in conjunction with a trip to the Four Corners area. Hillerman's decriptions are carried out well for the most part and much of the filming looks like it took place in part of the region (although there is more green and water in the film than in the books.)  Wes Studi (a Comanche I believe) is a dead ringer for Joe Leaphorm, and Adam Beach ( a Canadian Indian) plays a suburb Jim Chee.  Leaphorm in the no-nonsense connect the dots on the map investigator while Chee is a wannabe Singer in a police uniform.  Between them they solve crimes following different methods and paths that finally come together to find justice and regain order.  THIEF OF TIME is one of the better books and is a good movie about the conflicts of science -- prsuit of knowledge versus pursit of personal fame.  COYOTE WAITS examines the responsibiities of kin and clan.  The story has been radically altered without changing the real story.If you like Hillerman's Navajo stories, you will like these.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Read all of his fiction books years ago, and recently read some of his nonfiction books.  Wanted to view the DVD's (which were shown on PBS) to see more of the country.  He is a wonderful writer and brings all the color and excitement of New Mexico into his books, and Navajo ways.  He also has a terrific sense of humor.  Sorry I gave most of my books away, will have to start collecting again.  Wonderful, enjoyable stories!!!!!
summary: Tony Hillerman DVD Collection (Skinwalksrs, Coyote Waits, A Thief of Time)

reviewText: I really enjoy these adaptations of Tony Hillerman's books. Solid scripts, good actors, and flawless use of the scenery of the American Southwest make these a real treat. Wes Studi is one of my favorite actors, and he excels as LT Joe Leaphorn. The rest of the cast is excellent as well.
